comments:
TPTP Driver: 200610230100 and all dependencies from this build ID.

When locally attaching to a Java process for profiling on Linux ia32 with security enabled on the RAC,I get a JVM crash with exit code 11 on the first try in a new workspace. After re-launching the workspace and trying to Attach again, I get an error message indicating the hosts cannot be found and I am unable to proceed with profiling.

This works (first try, new workspace) with security disabled and the workaround for security enabled is to re-launch the workspace and try attaching to a Java process twice. On the second try it successfully attaches to the agent. I realize there is a workaround but due to the JVM crash which also crashes the Eclipse workbench I am setting as critical.

Steps to Attach on second attempt:


1) Enable security on the RAC
2) Start background java process(i.e :java -XrunpiAgent:server=controlled StartStop)
3) In the workbench, go to Profile> Attach-Java Process> 
4) Switch to the Agents Tab to discover an Agent


I get the following in the error log after the second attempt to Attach in the same workspace:


java.lang.NullPointerException
at org.eclipse.hyades.internal.execution.security.User.login(User.java:113)
at org.eclipse.hyades.internal.execution.local.control.NodeImpl.authenticateUser(NodeImpl.java:512)
at org.eclipse.hyades.security.internal.util.BaseConnectUtil.authenticateUser(BaseConnectUtil.java:631)
at org.eclipse.hyades.security.internal.util.ConnectUtilUI.promptAuthentication(ConnectUtilUI.java:146)
at org.eclipse.hyades.security.internal.util.BaseConnectUtil.promptAuthentication(BaseConnectUtil.java:256)
at org.eclipse.hyades.security.internal.util.BaseConnectUtil.connect(BaseConnectUtil.java:240)
at org.eclipse.hyades.security.internal.util.BaseConnectUtil.connect(BaseConnectUtil.java:538)
at org.eclipse.tptp.platform.common.ui.trace.internal.util.PDCoreUtil.profileConnect(PDCoreUtil.java:805)
at org.eclipse.hyades.trace.ui.internal.util.PDCoreUtil.getNodeConfiguration(PDCoreUtil.java:589)
at org.eclipse.hyades.trace.ui.internal.launcher.ProfileAttachDelegate.getNodeConfiguration(ProfileAttachDelegate.java:306)
at org.eclipse.hyades.trace.ui.internal.launcher.ProcessWrapperRunnable.run(ProcessWrapperRunnable.java:99)
at org.eclipse.hyades.trace.ui.internal.launcher.DeferredProcessAdapter.fetchDeferredChildren(DeferredProcessAdapter.java:55)
at org.eclipse.ui.progress.DeferredTreeContentManager$1.run(DeferredTreeContentManager.java:207)
at org.eclipse.core.internal.jobs.Worker.run(Worker.java:58)
Changed operating system to reflect where I produced this defect (Linux ia32).

this is the same callstack as from bug 161285.

Bug 161285 is reported against windows running in BC mode. I wonder if this is an issue with the tptp runtime rather than an AC/RAC issue.
Samson - Any ideas on a cause for this regression?  This bug along with its probable duplicate 161285 is a blocker for 4.3 I would think.  We can't crash on first use attempt.
*** Bug 160530 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***
Seems to be a platform independent workbench side problem with profiling and log import.
Set target to 4.3i3 since a patch is available and testing is in progress.
*** Bug 162129 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***

Created an attachment (id=53113)
Patch for duplicate bug 162129 

I am attaching my patch from 162129 in case a merge of the two fixes is needed.
